content.body: Specifically, http://wpt.live/mimesniff/mime-types/charset-parameter.window.html seems to expect the charset from `text/html;test=ÿ;charset=gbk` to be successfully parsed. Should the test field be ignored, re-encoded or set to the replacement character?
content.formatted_body: Specifically, http://wpt.live/mimesniff/mime-types/charset-parameter.window.html seems to expect the charset from text/html;test=ÿ;charset=gbk to be successfully parsed. Should the test field be ignored, re-encoded or set to the replacement character?

content.body:
> <@gingeh_:matrix.org> Hello, how should isomorphic decoding handle non-ASCII bytes (>0x7F)?

There's no special handling for ASCII vs. non-ASCII bytes. Bytes greater than 0x7F also go to their corresponding code point.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @gingeh_:matrix.org
Hello, how should isomorphic decoding handle non-ASCII bytes (>0x7F)?
There's no special handling for ASCII vs. non-ASCII bytes. Bytes greater than 0x7F also go to their corresponding code point.

content.body: 0xFF -> the code point U+00FF (ÿ), in particular.
* 0xFF <-> the code point U+00FF (ÿ), in particular.

m.new_content.body: 0xFF <-> the code point U+00FF (ÿ), in particular.

content.body: I see my mistake now, I had misinterpreted it as meaning "interpret bytes as UTF-8 bytes" not "interpret bytes as unicode code point values"
Yup, isomorphic as "same shape", just moving literally between the two encodings.
